pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 15)

Raag Jaitsree − Part 001 696 : 1 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl, First House, Chau−Padas: 696 : 2 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 696 : 3 The Jewel of the Lord's Name abides within my heart; the Guru has placed His hand on my forehead. 696 : 4 The sins and pains of countless incarnations have been cast out. The Guru has blessed me with the Naam, the Name of the Lord, and my debt has been paid off. ||1|| 696 : 5 O my mind, vibrate the Lord's Name, and all your affairs shall be resolved. 696 : 6 The Perfect Guru has implanted the Lord's Name within me; without the Name, life is useless. ||Pause|| 696 : 7 Without the Guru, the self−willed manmukhs are foolish and ignorant; they are forever entangled in emotional attachment to Maya. 696 : 8 They never serve the feet of the Holy; their lives are totally useless. ||2|| 696 : 9 2

Those who serve at the feet of the Holy, the feet of the Holy, their lives are made fruitful, and they belong to the Lord. 696 : 10 Make me the slave of the slave of the slaves of the Lord; bless me with Your Mercy, O Lord of the Universe. ||3|| 696 : 11 I am blind, ignorant and totally without wisdom; how can I walk on the Path? 696 : 12 I am blind − O Guru, please let me grasp the hem of Your robe, so that servant Nanak may walk in harmony with You. ||4||1|| 696 : 13 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 696 : 14 A jewel or a diamond may be very valuable and heavy, but without a purchaser, it is worth only straw. 696 : 15 When the Holy Guru, the Purchaser, saw this jewel, He purchased it for hundreds of thousands of dollars. ||1|| 696 : 16 The Lord has kept this jewel hidden within my mind. 696 : 17 The Lord, merciful to the meek, led me to meet the Holy Guru; meeting the Guru, I came to appreciate this jewel. ||Pause|| Raag Jaitsree − Part 001 3

696 : 18 The rooms of the self−willed manmukhs are dark with ignorance; in their homes, the jewel is not visible. 696 : 19 Those fools die, wandering in the wilderness, eating the poison of the snake, Maya. ||2|| 696 : 20 O Lord, Har, Har, let me meet the humble, holy beings; O Lord, keep me in the Sanctuary of the Holy. 696 : 21 O Lord, make me Your own; O God, Lord and Master, I have hurried to Your side. ||3|| 696 : 22 What Glorious Virtues of Yours can I speak and describe? You are great and unfathomable, the Greatest Being. 696 : 23 The Lord has bestowed His Mercy on servant Nanak; He has saved the sinking stone. ||4||2|| −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 001 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 001 4

Raag Jaitsree − Part 002 697 : 24 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 697 : 25 I am Your child; I know nothing about Your state and extent; I am foolish, idiotic and ignorant. 697 : 26 O Lord, shower me with Your Mercy; bless me with an enlightened intellect; I am foolish − make me clever. ||1|| 697 : 27 My mind is lazy and sleepy. 697 : 28 The Lord, Har, Har, has led me to meet the Holy Guru; meeting the Holy, the shutters have been opened wide. ||Pause|| 697 : 29 O Guru, each and every instant, fill my heart with love; the Name of my Beloved is my breath of life. 697 : 30 Without the Name, I would die; the Name of my Lord and Master is to me like the drug to the addict. ||2|| 697 : 31 Those who enshrine love for the Lord within their minds fulfill their pre−ordained destiny. 5

697 : 32 I worship their feet, each and every instant; the Lord seems very sweet to them. ||3|| 697 : 33 My Lord and Master, Har, Har, has showered His Mercy upon His humble servant; separated for so long, he is now re−united with the Lord. 697 : 34 Blessed, blessed is the True Guru, who has implanted the Naam, the Name of the Lord within me; servant Nanak is a sacrifice to Him. ||4||3|| 697 : 35 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 697 : 36 I have found the True Guru, my Friend, the Greatest Being. Love and affection for the Lord has blossomed forth. 697 : 37 Maya, the snake, has seized the mortal; through the Word of the Guru, the Lord neutralizes the venom. ||1|| 697 : 38 My mind is attached to the sublime essence of the Lord's Name. 697 : 39 The Lord has purified the sinners, uniting them with the Holy Guru; now, they taste the Lord's Name, and the sublime essence of the Lord. ||Pause|| 697 : 40 Blessed, blessed is the good fortune of those who meet the Holy Guru; meeting with the Holy, they lovingly center themselves in the state of absolute absorption. Raag Jaitsree − Part 002 6

697 : 41 The fire of desire within them is quenched, and they find peace; they sing the Glorious Praises of the Immaculate Lord. ||2|| 697 : 42 Those who do not obtain the Blessed Vision of the True Guru's Darshan, have misfortune pre−ordained for them. 697 : 43 In the love of duality, they are consigned to reincarnation through the womb, and they pass their lives totally uselessly. ||3|| 697 : 44 O Lord, please, bless me with pure understanding, that I may serve the Feet of the Holy Guru; the Lord seems sweet to me. 697 : 45 Servant Nanak begs for the dust of the feet of the Holy; O Lord, be Merciful, and bless me with it. ||4||4|| 697 : 46 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 697 : 47 The Lord's Name does not abide within their hearts − their mothers should have been sterile. 697 : 48 These bodies wander around, forlorn and abandoned, without the Name; their lives waste away, and they die, crying out in pain. ||1|| 697 : 49 Raag Jaitsree − Part 002 7

O my mind, chant the Name of the Lord, the Lord within you. 697 : 50 The Merciful Lord God, Har, Har, has showered me with His Mercy; the Guru has imparted spiritual wisdom to me, and my mind has been instructed. ||Pause|| 697 : 51 In this Dark Age of Kali Yuga, the Kirtan of the Lord's Praise brings the most noble and exalted status; the Lord is found through the True Guru. 697 : 52 I am a sacrifice to my True Guru, who has revealed the Lord's hidden Name to me. ||2|| 697 : 53 By great good fortune, I obtained the Blessed Vision of the Darshan of the Holy; it removes all stains of sin. 697 : 54 I have found the True Guru, the great, all−knowing King; He has shared with me the many Glorious Virtues of the Lord. ||3|| −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 002 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 002 8

Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 698 : 55 Those, unto whom the Lord, the Life of the world, has shown Mercy, enshrine Him within their hearts, and cherish Him in their minds. 698 : 56 The Righteous Judge of Dharma, in the Court of the Lord, has torn up my papers; servant Nanak's account has been settled. ||4||5|| 698 : 57 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 698 : 58 In the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, I found the Holy, by great good fortune; my restless mind has been quieted. 698 : 59 The unstruck melody ever vibrates and resounds; I have taken in the sublime essence of the Lord's Ambrosial Nectar, showering down. ||1|| 698 : 60 O my mind, chant the Name of the Lord, the beauteous Lord. 698 : 61 The True Guru has drenched my mind and body with the Love of the Lord, who has met me and lovingly embraced me. ||Pause|| 698 : 62 The faithless cynics are bound and gagged in the chains of Maya; they are actively engaged, gathering in the poisonous wealth. 9

698 : 63 They cannot spend this in harmony with the Lord, and so they must endure the pain which the Messenger of Death inflicts upon their heads. ||2|| 698 : 64 The Holy Guru has dedicated His Being to the Lord's service; with great devotion, apply the dust of His feet to your face. 698 : 65 In this world and the next, you shall receive the Lord's honor, and your mind shall be imbued with the permanent color of the Lord's Love. ||3|| 698 : 66 O Lord, Har, Har, please unite me with the Holy; compared to these Holy people, I am just a worm. 698 : 67 Servant Nanak has enshrined love for the feet of the Holy Guru; meeting with this Holy One, my foolish, stone−like mind has blossomed forth in lush profusion. ||4||6|| 698 : 68 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl, Second House: 698 : 69 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 698 : 70 Remember in meditation the Lord, Har, Har, the unfathomable, infinite Lord. 698 : 71 Remembering Him in meditation, pains are dispelled. Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 10

698 : 72 O Lord, Har, Har, lead me to meet the True Guru; meeting the Guru, I am at peace. ||1|| 698 : 73 Sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, O my friend. 698 : 74 Cherish the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, in your heart. 698 : 75 Read the Ambrosial Words of the Lord, Har, Har; meeting with the Guru, the Lord is revealed. ||2|| 698 : 76 The Lord, the Slayer of demons, is my breath of life. 698 : 77 His Ambrosial Amrit is so sweet to my mind and body. 698 : 78 O Lord, Har, Har, have mercy upon me, and lead me to meet the Guru, the immaculate Primal Being. ||3|| 698 : 79 The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is forever the Giver of peace. 698 : 80 My mind is imbued with the Lord's Love. 698 : 81 Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 11

O Lord Har, Har, lead me to meet the Guru, the Greatest Being; through the Name of Guru Nanak, I have found peace. ||4||1||7|| 698 : 82 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 698 : 83 Chant the Name of the Lord, Har, Har, Har, Har. 698 : 84 As Gurmukh, ever earn the profit of the Naam. 698 : 85 Implant within yourself devotion to the Lord, Har, Har, Har, Har; sincerely dedicate yourself to the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||1|| 698 : 86 Meditate on the Name of the Merciful Lord, Har, Har. 698 : 87 WIth love, forever sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 698 : 88 Dance to the Praises of the Lord, Har, Har, Har; meet with the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, with sincerity. ||2|| 698 : 89 Come, O companions − let us unite in the Lord's Union. 698 : 90 Listening to the sermon of the Lord, earn the profit of the Naam. Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 12
−− Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 003 13

Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 699 : 91 O Lord, Har, Har, be merciful to me, and lead me to meet the Guru; meeting the Guru, a sincere yearning for the Lord wells up in me. ||3|| 699 : 92 Praise Him, the unfathomable and inaccessible Lord. 699 : 93 Each and every moment, sing the Lord's Name. 699 : 94 Be merciful, and meet me, O Guru, Great Giver; Nanak yearns for the Lord's devotional worship. ||4||2||8|| 699 : 95 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 699 : 96 With love and energetic affection, praise the Lord, the storehouse of Nectar. 699 : 97 My mind is drenched with the Lord's Name, and so it earns this profit. 699 : 98 Each and every moment, worship Him in devotion, day and night; through the Guru's Teachings, sincere love and devotion well up. ||1|| 699 : 99 14

Chant the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe, Har, Har. 699 : 100 Conquering mind and body, I have earned the profit of the Shabad. 699 : 101 Through the Guru's Teachings, the five demons are over−powered, and the mind and body are filled with a sincere yearning for the Lord. ||2|| 699 : 102 The Name is a jewel − chant the Lord's Name. 699 : 103 Sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, and forever earn this profit. 699 : 104 O Lord, merciful to the meek, be kind to me, and bless me with sincere longing for the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. ||3|| 699 : 105 Meditate on the Lord of the world − meditate within your mind. 699 : 106 The Lord of the Universe, Har, Har, is the only real profit in this world. 699 : 107 Blessed, blessed, is my Great Lord and Master God; O Nanak, meditate on Him, worship Him with sincere love and devotion. ||4||3||9|| 699 : 108 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 15

699 : 109 He Himself is the Yogi, and the way throughout the ages. 699 : 110 The Fearless Lord Himself is absorbed in Samaadhi. 699 : 111 He Himself, all by Himself, is all−pervading; He Himself blesses us with sincere love for the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 699 : 112 He Himself is the lamp, and the Light pervading all the worlds. 699 : 113 He Himself is the True Guru; He Himself churns the ocean. 699 : 114 He Himself churns it, churning up the essence; meditating on the jewel of the Naam, sincere love comes to the surface. ||2|| 699 : 115 O my companions, let us meet and join together, and sing His Glorious Praises. 699 : 116 As Gurmukh, chant the Naam, and earn the profit of the Lord's Name. 699 : 117 Devotional worship of the Lord, Har, Har, has been implanted within me; it is pleasing to my mind. The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, brings a sincere love. ||3|| 699 : 118 Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 16

He Himself is supremely wise, the greatest King. 699 : 119 As Gurmukh, purchase the merchandise of the Naam. 699 : 120 O Lord God, Har, Har, bless me with such a gift, that Your Glorious Virtues seem pleasing to me; Nanak is filled with sincere love and yearning for the Lord. ||4||4||10|| 699 : 121 Jaitsree, Fourth Mehl: 699 : 122 Joining the Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, and associating with the Guru, 699 : 123 the Gurmukh gathers in the merchandise of the Naam. 699 : 124 O Lord, Har, Har, Destroyer of demons, have mercy upon me; bless me with a sincere yearning to join the Sat Sangat. ||1|| 699 : 125 Let me hear with my ears the Banis, the Hymns, in praise of the Lord; 699 : 126 be merciful, and let me meet the True Guru. 699 : 127 I sing His Glorious Praises, I speak the Bani of His Word; chanting His Glorious Praises, a sincere yearning for the Lord wells up. ||2|| Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 17

699 : 128 I have tried visiting all the sacred shrines of pilgrimage, fasting, ceremonial feasts and giving to charities. 699 : 129 They do not measure up to the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 699 : 130 The Lord's Name is unweighable, utterly heavy in weight; through the Guru's Teachings, a sincere yearning to chant the Name has welled up in me. ||3|| 699 : 131 All good karma and righteous living are found in meditation on the Lord's Name. 699 : 132 It washes away the stains of sins and mistakes. 699 : 133 Be merciful to meek, humble Nanak; bless him with sincere love and yearning for the Lord. ||4||5||11|| −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 004 18

Raag Jaitsree − Part 005 700 : 134 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl, Third House: 700 : 135 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 700 : 136 Does anyone know, who is our friend in this world? 700 : 137 He alone understands this, whom the Lord blesses with His Mercy. Immaculate and unstained is his way of life. ||1||Pause|| 700 : 138 Mother, father, spouse, children, relatives, lovers, friends and siblings meet, having been associated in previous lives; but none of them will be your companion and support in the end. ||1|| 700 : 139 Pearl necklaces, gold, rubies and diamonds please the mind, but they are only Maya. 700 : 140 Possessing them, one passes his life in agony; he obtains no contentment from them. ||2|| 700 : 141 Elephants, chariots, horses as fast as the wind, wealth, land, and armies of four kinds 700 : 142 19

− none of these will go with him; he must get up and depart, naked. ||3|| 700 : 143 The Lord's Saints are the beloved lovers of God; sing of the Lord, Har, Har, with them. 700 : 144 O Nanak, in the Society of the Saints, you shall obtain peace in this world, and in the next world, your face shall be radiant and bright. ||4||1|| 700 : 145 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl, Third House, Du−Padas: 700 : 146 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 700 : 147 Give me a message from my Beloved − tell me, tell me! 700 : 148 I am wonder−struck, hearing the many reports of Him; tell them to me, O my happy sister soul−brides. ||1||Pause|| 700 : 149 Some say that He is beyond the world − totally beyond it, while others say that He is totally within it. 700 : 150 His color cannot be seen, and His pattern cannot be discerned. O happy soul−brides, tell me the truth! ||1|| 700 : 151 Raag Jaitsree − Part 005 20

He is pervading everywhere, and He dwells in each and every heart; He is not stained − He is unstained. 700 : 152 Says Nanak, listen, O people: He dwells upon the tongues of the Saints. ||2||1||2|| 700 : 153 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 700 : 154 I am calmed, calmed and soothed, hearing of God. ||1||Pause|| 700 : 155 I dedicate my soul, my breath of life, my mind, body and everything to Him: I behold God near, very near. ||1|| 700 : 156 Beholding God, the inestimable, infinite and Great Giver, I cherish Him in my mind. ||2|| 700 : 157 Whatever I wish for, I receive; my hopes and desires are fulfilled, meditating on God. ||3|| 700 : 158 By Guru's Grace, God dwells in Nanak's mind; he never suffers or grieves, having realized God. ||4||2||3|| 700 : 159 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 700 : 160 I seek my Friend the Lord. Raag Jaitsree − Part 005 21

700 : 161 In each and every home, sing the sublime songs of rejoicing; He abides in each and every heart. ||1||Pause|| 700 : 162 In good times, worship and adore Him; in bad times, worship and adore Him; do not ever forget Him. 700 : 163 Chanting the Naam, the Name of the Lord, the light of millions of suns shines forth, and the darkness of doubt is dispelled. ||1|| 700 : 164 In all the spaces and interspaces, everywhere, whatever we see is Yours. 700 : 165 One who finds the Society of the Saints, O Nanak, is not consigned to reincarnation again. ||2||3||4|| −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 005 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 005 22

Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 701 : 166 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl, Fourth House, Du−Padas: 701 : 167 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 701 : 168 Now, I have found peace, bowing before the Guru. 701 : 169 I have abandoned cleverness, quieted my anxiety, and renounced my egotism. ||1||Pause|| 701 : 170 When I looked, I saw that everyone was enticed by emotional attachment; then, I hurried to the Guru's Sanctuary. 701 : 171 In His Grace, the Guru engaged me in the Lord's service, and then, the Messenger of Death gave up pursuing me. ||1|| 701 : 172 I swam across the ocean of fire, when I met the Saints, through great good fortune. 701 : 173 O servant Nanak, I have found total peace; my consciousness is attached to the Lord's feet. ||2||1||5|| 701 : 174 23

Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 701 : 175 Within my mind, I cherish and meditate on the True Guru. 701 : 176 He has implanted within me spiritual wisdom and the Mantra of the Lord's Name; Dear God has shown mercy to me. ||1||Pause|| 701 : 177 Death's noose and its mighty entanglements have vanished, along with the fear of death. 701 : 178 I have come to the Sanctuary of the Merciful Lord, the Destroyer of pain; I am holding tight to the Support of His feet. ||1|| 701 : 179 The Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, has assumed the form of a boat, to cross over the terrifying world−ocean. 701 : 180 I drink in the Ambrosial Nectar, and my doubts are shattered; says Nanak, I can bear the unbearable. ||2||2||6|| 701 : 181 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 701 : 182 One who has the Lord of the Universe as his help and support 701 : 183 Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 24

is blessed with all peace, poise and bliss; no afflictions cling to him. ||1||Pause|| 701 : 184 He appears to keep company with everyone, but he remains detached, and Maya does not cling to him. 701 : 185 He is absorbed in love of the One Lord; he understands the essence of reality, and he is blessed with wisdom by the True Guru. ||1|| 701 : 186 Those whom the Lord and Master blesses with His kindness, compassion and mercy are the sublime and sanctified Saints. 701 : 187 Associating with them, Nanak is saved; with love and exuberant joy, they sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||2||3||7|| 701 : 188 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 701 : 189 The Lord of the Universe is my existence, my breath of life, wealth and beauty. 701 : 190 The ignorant are totally intoxicated with emotional attachment; in this darkness, the Lord is the only lamp. ||1||Pause|| 701 : 191 Fruitful is the Blessed Vision of Your Darshan, O Beloved God; Your lotus feet are incomparably beautiful! Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 25

701 : 192 So many times, I bow in reverence to Him, offering my mind as incense to Him. ||1|| 701 : 193 Exhausted, I have fallen at Your Door, O God; I am holding tight to Your Support. 701 : 194 Please, lift Your humble servant Nanak up, out of the pit of fire of the world. ||2||4||8|| 701 : 195 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 701 : 196 If only someone would unite me with the Lord! 701 : 197 I hold tight to His feet, and utter sweet words with my tongue; I make my breath of life an offering to Him. ||1||Pause|| 701 : 198 I make my mind and body into pure little gardens, and irrigate them with the sublime essence of the Lord. 701 : 199 I am drenched with this sublime essence by His Grace, and the powerful hold of Maya's corruption has been broken. ||1|| 701 : 200 I have come to Your Sanctuary, O Destroyer of the suffering of the innocent; I keep my consciousness focused on You. −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 26
Raag Jaitsree − Part 006 27

Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 702 : 201 Bless me with the gifts of the state of fearlessness, and meditative remembrance, Lord and Master; O Nanak, God is the Breaker of bonds. ||2||5||9|| 702 : 202 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 702 : 203 The rainbird longs for the rain to fall. 702 : 204 O God, ocean of mercy, shower Your mercy on me, that I may yearn for loving devotional worship of the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 702 : 205 The chakvi duck does not desire many comforts, but it is filled with bliss upon seeing the dawn. 702 : 206 The fish cannot survive any other way − without water, it dies. ||1|| 702 : 207 I am a helpless orphan − I seek Your Sanctuary, O My Lord and Master; please bless me with Your mercy. 702 : 208 Nanak worships and adores the Lord's lotus feet; without Him, there is no other at all. ||2||6||10|| 28

702 : 209 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 702 : 210 The Lord, my very breath of life, abides in my mind and body. 702 : 211 Bless me with Your mercy, and unite me with the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, O perfect, all−knowing Lord God. ||1||Pause|| 702 : 212 Those, unto whom You give the intoxicating herb of Your Love, drink in the supreme sublime essence. 702 : 213 I cannot describe their value; what power do I have? ||1|| 702 : 214 The Lord attaches His humble servants to the hem of His robe, and they swim across the world−ocean. 702 : 215 Meditating, meditating, meditating in remembrance on God, peace is obtained; Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of Your Door. ||2||7||11|| 702 : 216 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 702 : 217 After wandering through so many incarnations, I have come to Your Sanctuary. Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 29

702 : 218 Save me − lift my body up out of the deep, dark pit of the world, and attach me to Your feet. ||1||Pause|| 702 : 219 I do not know anything about spiritual wisdom, meditation or karma, and my way of life is not clean and pure. 702 : 220 Please attach me to the hem of the robe of the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy; help me to cross over the terrible river. ||1|| 702 : 221 Comforts, riches and the sweet pleasures of Maya − do not implant these within your mind. 702 : 222 Slave Nanak is satisfied and satiated by the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan; his only ornamentation is the love of the Lord's Name. ||2||8||12|| 702 : 223 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl: 702 : 224 O humble servants of the Lord, remember the Lord in meditation within your heart. 702 : 225 Misfortune does not even approach the Lord's humble servant; the works of His slave are perfectly fulfilled. ||1||Pause|| 702 : 226 Millions of obstacles are removed, by serving the Lord, and one enters into the eternal dwelling of the Lord of the Universe. Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 30

702 : 227 The Lord's devotee is very fortunate; he has absolutely no fear. Even the Messenger of Death pays homage to him. ||1|| 702 : 228 Forsaking the Lord of the world, he does other deeds, but these are temporary and transitory. 702 : 229 Grasp the Lord's lotus feet, and hold them in your heart, O Nanak; you shall obtain absolute peace and bliss. ||2||9||13|| 702 : 230 Jaitsree, Ninth Mehl: One Universal Creator God. 702 : 231 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 702 : 232 My mind is deluded, entangled in Maya. 702 : 233 Whatever I do, while engaged in greed, only serves to bind me down. ||1||Pause|| 702 : 234 I have no understanding at all; I am engrossed in the pleasures of corruption, and I have forgotten the Praises of the Lord. 702 : 235 The Lord and Master is with me, but I do not know Him. Instead, I run into the forest, looking for Him. ||1|| Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 31
−− Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 007 32

Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 703 : 236 The Jewel of the Lord is deep within my heart, but I do not have any knowledge of Him. 703 : 237 O servant Nanak, without vibrating, meditating on the Lord God, human life is uselessly wasted and lost. ||2||1|| 703 : 238 Jaitsree, Ninth Mehl: 703 : 239 O Dear Lord, please, save my honor! 703 : 240 The fear of death has entered my heart; I cling to the Protection of Your Sanctuary, O Lord, ocean of mercy. ||1||Pause|| 703 : 241 I am a great sinner, foolish and greedy; but now, at last, I have grown weary of committing sins. 703 : 242 I cannot forget the fear of dying; this anxiety is consuming my body. ||1|| 703 : 243 I have been trying to liberate myself, running around in the ten directions. 703 : 244 33

The pure, immaculate Lord abides deep within my heart, but I do not understand the secret of His mystery. ||2|| 703 : 245 I have no merit, and I know nothing about meditation or austerities; what should I do now? 703 : 246 O Nanak, I am exhausted; I seek the shelter of Your Sanctuary; O God, please bless me with the gift of fearlessness. ||3||2|| 703 : 247 Jaitsree, Ninth Mehl: 703 : 248 O mind, embrace true contemplation. 703 : 249 Without the Lord's Name, know that this whole world is false. ||1||Pause|| 703 : 250 The Yogis are tired of searching for Him, but they have not found His limit. 703 : 251 You must understand that the Lord and Master is near at hand, but He has no form or feature. ||1|| 703 : 252 The Naam, the Name of the Lord is purifying in the world, and yet you never remember it. 703 : 253 Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 34

Nanak has entered the Sanctuary of the One, before whom the whole world bows down; please, preserve and protect me, by Your innate nature. ||2||3|| 703 : 254 Jaitsree, Fifth Mehl, Chhant, First House: 703 : 255 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 703 : 256 Shalok: 703 : 257 I am thirsty for the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan, day and night; I yearn for Him constantly, night and day. 703 : 258 Opening the door, O Nanak, the Guru has led me to meet with the Lord, my Friend. ||1|| 703 : 259 Chhant: 703 : 260 Listen, O my intimate friend − I have just one prayer to make. 703 : 261 I have been wandering around, searching for that enticing, sweet Beloved. 703 : 262 Whoever leads me to my Beloved − I would cut off my head and offer it to him, even if I were granted the Blessed Vision of His Darshan for just an instant. Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 35

703 : 263 My eyes are drenched with the Love of my Beloved; without Him, I do not have even a moment's peace. 703 : 264 My mind is attached to the Lord, like the fish to the water, and the rainbird, thirsty for the raindrops. 703 : 265 Servant Nanak has found the Perfect Guru; his thirst is totally quenched. ||1|| 703 : 266 O intimate friend, my Beloved has all these loving companions; I cannot compare to any of them. 703 : 267 O intimate friend, each of them is more beautiful than the others; who could consider me? 703 : 268 Each of them is more beautiful than the others; countless are His lovers, constantly enjoying bliss with Him. 703 : 269 Beholding them, desire wells up in my mind; when will I obtain the Lord, the treasure of virtue? 703 : 270 I dedicate my mind to those who please and attract my Beloved. 703 : 271 Says Nanak, hear my prayer, O happy soul−brides; tell me, what does my Husband Lord look like? ||2|| Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 36
703 : 272 O intimate friend, my Husband Lord does whatever He pleases; He is not dependent on anyone. −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 −− Raag Jaitsree − Part 008 37

Raag Jaitsree − Part 009 704 : 273 O intimate friend, you have enjoyed your Beloved; please, tell me about Him. 704 : 274 They alone find their Beloved, who eradicate self−conceit; such is the good destiny written on their foreheads. 704 : 275 Taking me by the arm, the Lord and Master has made me His own; He has not considered my merits or demerits. 704 : 276 She, whom You have adorned with the necklace of virtue, and dyed in the deep crimson color of His Love − everything looks beautiful on her. 704 : 277 O servant Nanak, blessed is that happy soul−bride, who dwells with her Husband Lord. ||3|| 704 : 278 O intimate friend, I have found that peace which I sought. 704 : 279 My sought−after Husband Lord has come home, and now, congratulations are pouring in. 704 : 280 Great joy and happiness welled up, when my Husband Lord, of ever−fresh beauty, showed mercy to me. 704 : 281 38
